comment: Great introduction to programming! The professor was very helpful and made complex concepts easy to understand.
Challenging but rewarding. Lots of hands-on assignments that really helped me learn Python fundamentals.
Great follow-up to CS I. Learning C++ was tough but Professor Samary explained memory management really well.
Loved diving into lower-level programming concepts. The Git and command line portions were especially useful.
Mathematical foundations were important but quite abstract. Professor McTague was knowledgeable but course was demanding.
Challenging course but essential for understanding theoretical CS. The logic and computation topics were fascinating.
Amazing web development course! Professor Yun made React concepts clear and the final project was really engaging.
Great practical course. Learned so much about HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and React. Very applicable to real-world projects.
Clear explanations and good examples. Homework was tough but Professor Tao was always willing to help during office hours.
Loved the class! Professor made multivariable calculus interesting with great visualizations and real-world applications.
Differential equations were challenging but Professor Tao explained the applications really well. Great for STEM majors.
Solid course content but quite demanding. Make sure you're comfortable with calculus before taking this.
Abstract algebra was mind-bending but Professor Kelmer made the abstract concepts as concrete as possible. Great course!
Absolutely fascinating subject matter. Challenging but incredibly rewarding when you start to see the patterns and structures.
Excellent introduction to probability theory. Professor Chambers used real data examples which made concepts much clearer.
Loved this course! The combination of theory and computer applications made probability come alive. Highly recommend!
Perfect intro biology course for non-majors! Professor Martinez explained everything clearly and made biology accessible and interesting.
Great course for getting a solid foundation in biology. The molecular concepts were challenging but well-explained.
Essential course for biology majors. Professor Chen did an amazing job explaining complex cellular processes and biochemistry.
Challenging but fundamental course. The cellular organization and metabolism topics were particularly well-covered.
Fantastic lab course! Professor Williams guided us through real research techniques. The molecular cloning and genetic analysis were incredibly valuable.
Intensive but rewarding lab experience. Learning to design experiments and analyze results was challenging but essential for research.
Professor Thompson made genetics fascinating! The population genetics and genomics sections were particularly well-explained.
Solid genetics course but quite demanding. The chromosome structure and gene regulation topics required a lot of study time.
Great introduction to chemistry! Professor Davis explained chemical equilibrium and atomic structure clearly. Challenging but fair.
Excellent foundation for pre-med students. The quantitative relationships and periodic table concepts were thoroughly covered.
Professor Deak made organic chemistry approachable. The reaction mechanisms were complex but well-explained with good examples.
Challenging course that requires dedication. The lab work was intensive but helped solidify the theoretical concepts.
This biochemistry course was outstanding! The biomolecule structures and metabolic pathways were clearly explained.
Advanced course that ties together biology and chemistry beautifully. The disease-related examples made the material very relevant.
Professor Hattori made music theory accessible and engaging! The harmony and chord progression sections were particularly enjoyable.
Great core course for music appreciation. The keyboard skills lab was challenging but really helped with understanding theory concepts.
